dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 963 IH: Coordination of Pro Bono Medically Recommended Dental Care Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. DeGette (for herself and Mr. Stivers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To assist low-income individuals in obtaining medically recommended dental care.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Coordination of Pro Bono Medically Recommended Dental Care Act.

section.header: Grants or contracts to facilitate low-income access to dental care
section.text: Part B of title III of the Public Health Service Act is amended by inserting after section 317M (42 U.S.C. 247b–14a) the following new section:

section.header: Grants or contracts to facilitate low-income access to dental care

subsection.text: The Secretary shall award competitive grants to, or enter into contracts with, eligible entities to maximize the number of eligible low-income individuals receiving dental care.
An entity shall use amounts received under a grant or contract under this section to fund the employment costs of a program to—

paragraph.text: coordinate the provision of free, medically recommended dental care to eligible low-income individuals by volunteer dentists in a manner consistent with State licensing laws; and
verify the medical, dental, and financial needs of eligible low-income individuals who may be eligible for such dental services.
To be eligible to receive a grant or contract under subsection (a), an entity shall—

subparagraph.text: submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require.

paragraph.text: To be eligible to participate in a program described in paragraph (1)(B), an individual shall be—

subparagraph.text: an individual enrolled in part B of title XVIII of such Act;
an individual enrolled in a State plan or waiver under title XIX of such Act; or
an individual enrolled in a State child health plan under title XXI of such Act or under an approved waiver of such plan.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section, $2,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2014 through 2018.
